original: NYSTRÖM, Harry Gotthard, Civilingenjör, Stockholm, f Kristinehamn 27/7 98 av bkdir M N o Anna Lundgren, gm Märtha Svensson. Studex 16, KTH 20, stud Tyskl 21—22. Ing AGA 23—24, dir Sv el.ind.frn sed. 25, sekr Sv el.kommiss sed. 25, d:o Frn f el:s ration an-vändn sed. 28 o Sv radiointressentfrb sed. 29, led Brandf örs.anst :as el nmd 35, ordf Sv konsthartsind :s råvaru- & imp.frn sed. 39, styr.led Sv låsmutterAB o AB Kraftemballage, KSSS 32, dess sekr sed. 36. Resor: Span 23— 24, USA 26, 36, 39. Av trycket: Segel 35, red f Havsörnen 29—30. RVO, PatrGM, RFinlLO-Ikl, Off LettSO, FinlMM; KSSS ftjgm, skyt- 0 seglm g, idr- o skidl.m. Hobby: Segling.
translated: NYSTRÖM, Harry Gotthard, Civil Engineer, Stockholm, born in Kristinehamn on July 27, 1898, son of a bank clerk, Magnus Nystrom, and Anna Lundgren, married to Märtha Svensson. Graduated from school at 16, attended the Royal Institute of Technology from 1920 to 1921, and studied German from 1921 to 1922. Employed at AGA from 1923 to 1924, later became the director of the Swedish Electric Industry from 1925. Secretary for the Swedish Electric Commission from 1925, and also involved in electrical rationing from 1928 and the Swedish Radio Interest Association from 1929. He was a member of the Fire Insurance Company's Electrical Committee from 1935, chairman of the Swedish Synthetic Resin Industry's Raw Material and Import Company from 1939, and a board member of the Swedish Locknut AB and AB Kraftemballage. Secretary of the Royal Swedish Yacht Club from 1936. Traveled to Spain in 1923-1924 and the United States in 1926, 1936, and 1939. Published the book "Segel" in 1935 and was editor of the magazine "Havsörnen" from 1929 to 1930. Received the Order of the Vasa, Patriotic GM, Order of the White Rose (Finland), Officer of the Order of the Yugoslav Flag, Order of the Lion of Finland (First Class), Member of the Royal Swedish Yacht Club, Shooter and Sailor (multiple distinctions), Sports and Skiing Medalist. Hobby: Sailing.

structured.description: Harry Gotthard Nyström, born on July 27, 1898, in Kristinehamn, Sweden, was a Swedish Civil Engineer. He served as the Director of the Swedish Electric Industry in 1925 and as the Secretary of the Swedish Electric Commission in the same year. He also held positions in various other organizations such as the Fire Insurance Company's Electrical Committee starting in 1935, and he became the Chairman of the Swedish Synthetic Resin Industry's Raw Material and Import Company in 1939. Harry was a member of the Royal Swedish Yacht Club and held the position of Secretary from 1936. He was actively involved in the Swedish Radio Interest Association as a Secretary since 1929. Harry Nyström received several awards throughout his career, including the Order of the Vasa and the Order of the White Rose of Finland. He was also known for his sailing skills and represented the Royal Swedish Yacht Club as a Yacht Captain. Additionally, he was a medalist in the field of sports and skiing. Harry Nyström's hobbies included sailing.

career.workplace: Swedish Synthetic Resin Industry's Raw Material and Import Company
